title: What time is Strictly Come Dancing’s movie week on tonight?
text:
Strictly is gearing up for its annual movie week – with another couple set to depart (Picture: BBC)

Strictly Come Dancing 2019 has only been on the air for a couple of weeks but we’ve already bid farewell to our first couple of the series.

Last weekend saw James Cracknell and pro partner Luba Mushtuk hang up their dancing shoes after losing out to David James and Nadiya Bychkova in this year’s first elimination show.

Which means we have 14 remaining couples taking to the floor on Saturday night for the show’s annual Movie Week – which promises routines inspired by the likes of Austin Powers and Mary Poppins, as well as the first Couple’s Choice of the series.

It’s set to be unmissable – but what time does it kick off?

Here’s what you need to know…

What time is Strictly Come Dancing’s movie week on tonight?

Last weekend saw James and Luba become the first couple to depart the show (Picture: BBC)

Strictly Come Dancing’s movie week kicks off on BBC One at a slightly later time than usual – 7.10pm, following BBC One’s live coverage of the World Athletics Championships.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Once again it’s a pretty long show, running for two hours and 10 minutes ahead of Casualty at 9.20pm.

The results show, meanwhile, airs on BBC One on Sunday night at 7.15pm.

If you’ve missed any instalments so far you can catch up with them on BBC iPlayer.

Who is dancing what on Strictly this week?

Lights, camera, #Strictly Movie Week! Time to reveal ALL the blockbuster routines for Saturday 🍿👉https://t.co/ePZRBqUI1t pic.twitter.com/Qg3NzG5KeG — BBC Strictly ✨ (@bbcstrictly) October 1, 2019

Here’s what you’ll be seeing on the night:

Emma Barton and Anton Du Beke – Salsa to Soul Bossa Nova Austin Powers

Michelle Visage and Giovanni Pernice – Quickstep to Caberet by Liza Minelli from Cabaret

Dev Griffin and Dianne Buswell – Couples’ Choice to Friend Like Me from Aladdin

Kelvin Fletcher and Oti Mabuse – Charleston to Trip A Little Light Fantastic from Mary Poppins Returns

Chris Ramsey and Karen Clifton – American Smooth to Cheek to Cheek from Top Hat

Emma Weymouth and Aljaz Skorjanec – Foxtrot to the Downton Abbey theme

Karim Zeroual and Amy Dowden – Samba to Kung Fu Fighting from Kung Fu Panda

Alex Scott and Neil Jones will be – Rumba to How Far I’ll Go from Moana

Will Bayley and Janette Manrara – Paso Doble to Gotta Catch ‘Em All from Pokemon

Catherine Tyldesley and Johannes Radebe – Rumba to Shallow from A Star Is Born

David James and Nadiya Bychkova – American Smooth to Kiss From A Rose from Batman Forever

Anneka Rice and Kevin Clifton – Charleston to Woo Hoo from Kill Bill

Mike Bushnell and Katya Jones – Cha Cha to It’s Raining Men from Magic Mike

Saffron Barker and AJ Pritchard – Paso Doble to Everybody Wants To Rule The World from The Hunger Games

Got a showbiz story? If you've got a story, video or pictures get in touch with the Metro.co.uk Entertainment team by emailing us celebtips@metro.co.uk, calling 020 3615 2145 or by visiting our Submit Stuff page - we'd love to hear from you.

description: Strictly Come Dancing is playing host to its annual movie week this weekend - but what time should you tune in?
